title: Ex-U-M assistant charged with computer hacking
content: A former NFL and University of Michigan assistant football coach hacked into the computer accounts of thousands of college athletes seeking intimate photos and videos, according to an indictment filed Thursday.

title: Norfolk St. 'angry' over 28.5-pt. underdog status
content: Norfolk State coach Robert Jones, whose Spartans are 28.5-point underdogs to No. 1 seed Florida, is "a little angry" over how heavily the Gators are favored over his club for Friday's first-round matchup in the NCAA tournament.

title: Celtics sold for record $6.1 billion, sources say
content: Bill Chisholm has agreed to purchase the Boston Celtics from the Grousbeck family for a valuation for $6.1 billion, sources told ESPN.

title: UGA suspends WR Tuggle, OL Easley indefinitely
content: Georgia sophomore wide receiver Nitro Tuggle and freshman offensive lineman Marques Easley were suspended indefinitely on Thursday after Tuggle's arrest for speeding and reckless driving.

title: 'Pain-free' Flagg ready for Duke's tourney run
content: Cooper Flagg says he is "pain-free" following his ankle injury and expects to be fully healthy for Duke's NCAA tournament opener against Mount St. Mary's.

title: Deebo ready to repay Commanders' 'trust in me'
content: After the Washington Commanders traded for him, then guaranteed the last year of his contract receiver Deebo Samuel said he wants to repay the belief he says they've shown in him.

title: Battery charge against fighter Diaz dismissed
content: A misdemeanor battery charge against combat sports star Nate Diaz, which stem from an altercation with a nightclub bouncer in Las Vegas last year, has been dismissed.

title: The blessing and curse of UCLA's Lauren Betts' 6-7 height
content: Lauren Betts was called an alien, a giraffe. Now she's ready to dominate -- not for the bullies, for herself -- as UCLA goes for its first NCAA title.

title: Debating free agency: Which teams improved the most over the past two weeks?
content: We asked 10 experts to weigh in on the most improved teams, top bargains and head-scratching decisions.

title: Next stop, Tampa: Experts predict women's Final Four and 2025 national champion
content: Which team will cut down the nets in Tampa? ESPN's experts pick the Final Four, the title game matchup and 2025 champion.

title: Short an ace? In a loaded AL East? Here's why the Orioles think they can win anyway
content: Their window is wide-open, but they're 0-5 in October the past two seasons. Are they wasting an opportunity -- or is this their year?

title: NHL playoff watch: How the West's second wild-card spot will be won
content: The Canucks-Blues showdown on Thursday (7:30 p.m. ET on ESPN+) could swing the race. Plus, full playoff projections, draft lottery standings and more.

title: What to watch for in March internationals: Tuchel's England debut, Ronaldo goals, Poch's first big U.S. test
content: It's the first internationals of the year! There's lots happening as World Cup qualifying ramps up and European teams face off in the Nations League.

title: New women's 7 vs. 7 league touting $5M purses
content: A new global 7-on-7 women's soccer event is set to launch ahead of the UEFA Women's Champions League final in May with the promise of a $5 million prize pool per event.

title: Andy Robertson: Liverpool career far from over
content: Andrew Robertson has brushed off criticism of his Liverpool performances this season and insisted that his time at Anfield is not coming to an end.

title: Mbappé accepts past mistakes as France captain
content: Kylian Mbappé returns to lead France against Croatia after a six-month absence and on Wednesday criticized himself over how he handled the captaincy before.

title: Source: Amorim to make call on Sancho future
content: Manchester United will let Ruben Amorim decide Jadon Sancho's future in the unlikely event that the England forward returns to Old Trafford, a source has told ESPN.

title: McKennie: U.S. needs 'nastiness' in CNL defense
content: United States midfielder Weston McKennie said it's "about time" that the U.S. brings some "nastiness" to its game ahead of Thursday's Concacaf Nations League semifinal against Panama.

title: Chelsea ink Sporting pair, deals worth up to $80M
content: Chelsea have reached an agreement to sign Sporting Lisbon's Geovany Quenda and Dario Essugo in a joint deal worth up to €74.4 million ($81.15 million), the Portuguese side confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Ex-Utd defender Jones 'embarrassed' by injuries
content: Former Manchester United defender Phil Jones has said he was "embarrassed" by the injuries that blighted his Old Trafford career.

title: Martinez joins Messi, out for World Cup qualifiers
content: Argentina striker Lautaro Martinez will miss their upcoming World Cup qualifiers against Uruguay and Brazil due to a hamstring injury, the Argentine FA said on Wednesday.

title: Nine potential busts to avoid in 2025
content: Who does Tristan H. Cockcroft think will underachieve in 2025? We have nine names to steer clear of when drafting your rosters.

title: Astros pay homage to city's space history with second City Connect threads
content: Featuring "Stros" on the front of the jersey marks the organization's first official use of the fan-driven moniker.

title: Scheffler stays true to roots with Masters menu
content: From cowboy ribeye to chili, the Texas native and two-time Augusta winner left his mark for the champions dinner.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Edwards' path to victory at UFC Fight Night
content: Who has the edge in Saturday's UFC Fight Night from London? An MMA fighter and betting insider make their picks.

title: NCAA Wrestling Championships: Schedule, rules, scoring, stats
content: The NCAA men's Division I wrestling championships start Thursday; here's how to watch Penn State, Iowa and more.

title: López, Dumornay, Shaw lead best U21 women's soccer players
content: Welcome to the next generation of women's stars aged 21 or under, with representatives from the NWSL, WSL and across Europe.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United prepare €48m offer for Nmecha
content: Manchester United have identified Borussia Dortmund midfielder Felix Nmecha as a key target. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: The Seattle Mariners are getting a Nintendo-themed makeover with new jerseys
content: Nintendo, which has a 10 percent ownership stake in the Mariners, will be the team's first-ever jersey sleeve partner.

title: "48 MLAs Honey Trapped": Targeted Karnataka Minister Calls For Probe
content: The Karnataka minister targetted with a failed honey trap said today not just him, but 48 MLAs have been targeted this way over the last 20 years. KN Rajanna, known to be close to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, was targeted twice,

title: "Very Good Relationship, But...": Trump's Latest Tariff Comment On India
content: President Donald Trump said he has a "very good relationship" with India, but the "only problem" he has with the country is that it is "one of the highest tariffing nations in the world."

title: National Anthem Plays, Nitish Kumar Talks, Laughs, Fidgets At Sports Meet
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar came under opposition attack again after he was caught on camera laughing and talking during the national anthem at a sports event in Patna today.

title: UP Professor, Accused Of Raping Students, Arrested After 72 Hours On The Run
content: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj have arrested a 50-year-old Geography professor accused of sexually abusing his students - he allegedly filmed these acts and used these 59 videos to blackmail them.

title: Upset Over Salary Cut, Driver Started Bus Fire That Killed 4 In Pune: Cops
content: The fire on a private firm's minibus that killed four employees near Pune was allegedly an act of sabotage by a vengeful driver who had a dispute with some staffers and was also upset over a pay cut, police said on Thursday.

title: "Attempt To Malign...": Aaditya Thackeray On Disha Salian's Father's Plea
content: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Friday rubbished calls for a police case to be filed against him, and an inquiry to be conducted by the CBI, over the death by suicide of celebrity manager Disha Salian at her flat in Mumbai in June 2020.

title: "No Sympathy For Sunita Williams Because...": Neil deGrasse Tyson Exclusive
content: Plastic cups and time to readjust to Earth's gravity - that is what Sunita Williams, whose eight-day mission to the International Space Station extended to a nine-month stay, will need to recover, astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson told NDTV.

title: 1 Auto, 14 Children: Video Of UP Cop's Traffic Stop Goes Viral
content: A cop stopped an autorickshaw for checking at an intersection in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi. The police officer was surprised when he saw 14 schoolchildren travelling in a small auto.

title: "Regret Moving Out Of Noida": Corporate Employee Lists Issues With Bengaluru
content: Bengaluru, the Silicon Valley of India, continues to attract IT professionals from across the country. But not everyone finds the city a perfect fit.

title: "Papa Drum Mein Hain," Murdered Meerut Man's Daughter, 6, Told Neighbours
content: The six-year-old daughter of Saurabh Rajput, allegedly murdered by his wife Muskaan Rastogi and her lover Sahil Shukla, kept telling neighbours, "Papa drum mein hai", Saurabh's mother Renu Devi has said

title: Couple's Photo Shoot Goes Wrong, Colour-Bomb Malfunctions And Burns Bride
content: An India-origin couple from Canada, who travelled to India for their wedding celebration, were left distraught after a colour bomb malfunctioned and injured the bride on their big day.

title: Jaipur Woman, Lover Kill Husband. CCTV Shows Them Carrying Body On Bike
content: A couple on a bike, the woman riding pillion with a large bundle in her arms - a seemingly innocuous security video from Rajasthan's Jaipur has gone viral after the white bundle turned out to be a body.

title: Finland Is World's Happiest Country For 8th Year, India Stands At...
content: Released on the UN's International Day of Happiness, the report assesses the quality of life in over 140 countries based on resident feedback.

title: What Is Dark Energy? The Mystery Behind The Expanding Universe
content: Dark energy makes up roughly 70 percent of the universe, yet we know nothing about it. Around 25 percent of the universe is the equally mysterious dark matter, leaving just five percent for everything that we can see and touch.

title: Gurugram DM orders evacuation of unsafe towers in Chintels Paradiso housing society
content: Move comes after the towers of the flat were declared unsafe in the structural audit report; residents’ welfare association says order was invoked without proper planning

title: Chennai Metro Rail Limited conducts its first trial run on Phase II network amid a few technical glitches
content: The train departed Poonamallee Depot around 11.30 p.m. after initial delays. It was operated for a distance of 3 km and reached Mullaithottam around 11.45 p.m. The trials are likely to be held daily

title: Manipur’s long road to recovery
content: President’s Rule was imposed in Manipur on February 13, 2025, after 21 months of violence and arson, fuelled by tensions between the Kuki-Zo tribes and the Meitei community, leaving 62,000 people displaced. With trade, health care, and education hit, and businesses facing extortion and reduced demand, the Centre now has a 13-point agenda to restore stability. Vijaita Singh finds that many on both sides of the ethnic divide, however, long for peace

title: AIADMK files a review petition against order passed in case for freezing ‘two leaves’ symbol
content: Justices R. Subramanian and C. Kumarappan condone the delay of six days in filing the review plea and decide to hear the review after it gets numbered

title: CM Mamata sets up collective leadership of party functionaries, Ministers to keep a vigil during her U.K. visit
content: Mamata Banerjee will be on a seven-day visit to the U.K. starting March 22. She has nominated the party’s State’s president Subrata Bakshi and Trinamool national general secretary Abhishek Banerjee to look at the affairs of the party during her absence

title: Supreme Court Collegium proposes transfer of Orissa High Court Acting Chief Justice to Allahabad High Court
content: Justice Arindam Sinha has served as the Orissa HC’s Acting Chief Justice following the superannuation of its former Chief Justice Chakradhari Sharan Singh on January 19, 2025

title: Sweden’s AP Pension fund exits Bharat Electronics Limited over Myanmar military sale reports
content: The Ethics Council of Sweden’s AP Pension says BEL’s arms exports to the Myanmar military are “believed to contribute to the latter’s ability to commit violence against the country’s civilian population”

title: UPS: PFRDA notifies assured pension scheme for government employees
content: The regulations shall come into effect from April 1, the Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority said in a statement

title: TN should focus on people’s welfare rather than sending teams on delimitation: Tamilisai
content: The DMK government has failed in all aspects of governance including maintaining law and order, says Tamilisai

title: Drug seizure from hostel: a wake-up call for campuses
content: The seizure of commercial quantities of cannabis from a college hostel has served as a wake-up call to Kerala society on the grave issue of substance abuse among students of the State. M.P. Praveen looks into the gravity and the extent of the drug menace on campuses

title: Issues faced by democracies in South Asia discussed at international meet hosted by SRM University-A.P.
content: Conference, organised under the aegis of the Department of Political Science, Easwari School of Liberal Arts, explored the concept of democracy and its relevance to the current political landscape in South Asia

title: ED conducts searches across four States in SDPI case
content: Enforcement Directorate conducts searches in 4 states linked to money-laundering involving Social Democratic Party of India and Popular Front of India, seizing assets worth ₹61.72 crore

title: Health secretaries demand reduction of workload
content: While there are around 18,000 ANMs in the State, around 13,500, fall under the purview of the village and ward secretariats and are called health secretaries, and the remaining fall under the purview of Medical and Health Department

title: State schools to have lesson-based assessment, evaluation through app
content: Students from Classes 1 to 10 will be tested after completing each lesson at the school level to help assess learning outcomes

title: India, Brazil could play a key role in shaping climate talks: COP30 President-Designate
content: The U.S.’s exit from the Paris Agreement did not imply that Americans as a whole had abandoned the challenge of addressing warming, Andre Lago said

title: TGSPDCL secures 3rd rank in DUR-CSRD ratings
content: Telangana’s TGSPDCL ranks third in the Distribution Utilities Ranking 2023-24, excelling in consumer services and power reliability

title: Land acquired for public purposes cannot be returned to owner by beneficiary through private deal: Supreme Court
content: Govt. had acquired 33 acres for setting up a grain market in Narela, but Delhi Agricultural Marketing Board agreed to transfer half of the total land back to the owner

title: Supreme Court action sought against Allahabad High Court judge who sparked public outrage in ‘attempt to rape’ case
content: Judge had downgraded the charges against the accused who allegedly grabbed a child’s breasts and broke her pyjama strings; senior lawyers, BJP and Congress leaders among those demanding action

title: 25 Indians awarded death sentence in UAE, judgement yet to be implemented: Centre
content: The number of Indians executed or given capital punishment in Kuwait and Saudi Arabia in 2024 stood at three each, while the corresponding figure for Zimbabwe was one

title: National interest paramount in India's decisions on international oil purchases: Centre
content: A 60-day “winding down period” was also announced after which the U.S. was supposed to designate all those that continue to deal with sanctioned parties in Russia’s energy sector

title: KTR declares 2025 as ‘year of struggle,’ plans statewide padayatra
content: Addressing the BRS workers meet, KTR held Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy responsible for the drought conditions and water crisis at several places in the state

title: Rahul Gandhi says it’s ‘anti-national’ not to support caste census
content: Congress leader interacts with UGC Chairman, coinciding with the 98th anniversary of the Mahad Satyagraha of B.R. Ambedkar and emphasised importance of social justice

title: Opposition alleges ₹7,500-crore scam in awarding contract for procuring smart electricity meters
content: Govt. accused of awarding contract to a supplier rather than manufacturer, resulting in the meter cost going up

title: Farm leaders go on fast in custody; Samyukt Kisan Morcha groups say AAP, BJP stand for corporate interests
content: Samyukt Kisan Morcha-Non Political and the Kisan Mazdoor Morcha said in joint statement that the Punjab government had stabbed farmers in the back by arresting farmer leaders who were invited for a meeting

title: MHA reviews AFSPA in the Northeast, Army wants more areas in Manipur under Act
content: Final decision to be taken by the MHA; the Army proposed that 12 police station limits in valley districts be brought under the AFSPA for operational efficiency, say officials

title: Telangana gears up for Saraswati Pushkaralu 2025 with New App
content: A mobile app and improved amenities are planned for the Saraswati Pushkaralu festival at Kaleshwaram from May 15-26, 2025

title: PAC members flag failure of Swadesh Darshan scheme
content: As many as 76 projects were sanctioned under the scheme between 2014-15 and 2018-19 for ₹5,292.57 crore; panel says it is dissatisfied by the Tourism Ministry’s response to its review of the CAG report on the scheme

title: Union Minister’s nephew killed in gunfight with brother over drawing tap water in Bihar
content: Gun-battle erupts over tap water dispute in Bihar village, leaving Union Minister Nityananda Rai’s nephew dead and two injured

title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar caught laughing and talking during national anthem
content: RJD leaders slam Mr. Kumar’s behaviour as insulting and disrespectful to the national anthem and to the people of Bihar, questioning the CM’s mental and physical stability

title: Chief Minister Revanth Reddy slams BRS government for neglecting compassionate jobs, creating hurdles in development
content: The Chief Minister handed over appointment letters to 922 candidates, including over 500 who were appointed under compassionate grounds

title: Uncertainty looms over Karnataka bandh on March 22 as key groups remain undecided
content: On February 28, ‘Kannada Okkuta,’ an umbrella body representing multiple pro-Kannada organisations, formally announced the bandh, scheduled from 6 am to 6 pm.

title: Bihar Minister says RJD leader was involved in son’s kidnapping in 2007
content: The RJD leader had met him with a ransom demand but Nitish Kumar helped bring his son back, says BJP’s Santosh Kumar Singh; leaders trade blame, accusing each other over law and order issues

title: Tiruchi Corporation steps up efforts to ramp up revenue mobilisation
content: The total tax revenue has surpassed 50%. However, vacant land tax, water charges, non-tax revenue, and underground drainage (UGD) charges remain low, prompting further action in these areas

title: KFPA files defamation case against Jayan Cherthala
content: The KFPA filed the case after Mr. Jayan failed to respond to its February 2025 notice, which asked him to retract his claim that the producers’ body had yet to repay part of the financial support extended by the association of actors.

title: Traffic curbs in Hyderabad for Hazrat Ali procession on Friday
content: Traffic restrictions will be in place from 2 p.m. to 8 p.m. for the Hazrat Ali procession; commuters are advised to take alternate routes

title: Disgruntled bus driver started fire that claimed lives of four employees of Pune firm: Cops
content: The incident took place in the Hinjawadi area near Pune city on Wednesday (March 19, 2025) morning as the bus, owned by Vyoma Graphics and carrying 14 of its employees to the workplace, caught fire

title: Betting apps are like organised mafias, says Sajjanar
content: After raising the pitch against betting apps on social media, senior IPS officer V.C. Sajjanar stresses the need for reforms, citing cases linked to betting losses

title: UDF MLAs march to Secretariat, declare support for ASHAs
content: The State government should raise the honorarium and the Centre should revise the incentive pattern, demands Satheesan

title: Andhra Pradesh State Skill Development Corporation partners with Indian diaspora in Germany to launch Project SarvaSetu
content: Collaboration marks a significant step in bridging skill gaps and opening new career pathways for Indian youth in the international job market, says APSSDC chief

title: Glorifying invaders akin to ‘treason’, New India rejects ‘traitors’, U.P. CM Yogi says
content: U.P. CM Yogi Adityanath said that “New India” will not accept those who insult India’s great men or support the invaders who trampled Sanatana culture

title: Rare surgery performed on patient whose cornea was injured while playing Badminton
content: Pinhole pupilloplasty reduces the size of the pupil to that of a pinhole, limiting the amount of light entering the eye. This ensures that images focus sharply on the retina

title: Watch: Disregarding Threats: Tragic Murders and Police Failure in Tamil Nadu
content: On March 18, Zakhir Hussain Bijli, a former Police Sub-Inspector, was brutally hacked to death by a gang in broad daylight

title: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan welcomes SC sub-classification
content: It has become a reality because of the sustained efforts of MRPS leader Manda Krishna Madiga and Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, he says

title: NDA govt. committed to protecting Kolleru lake: JSP MLC
content: The reckless manner in which former CMs YSR and Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy dealt with the encroachments and other factors, led to the mess being faced now, alleges Hari Prasad

title: Defence Acquisition Council approves norms to cut down procurement timelines
content: Earlier, the Cabinet Committee on Security gave final approval for the procurement of 307 indigenously designed and developed artillery guns at a cost of ₹7,000 crore

title: Young India Police School conducts lottery for admissions
content: The school is scheduled to be formally inaugurated by Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy in the first week of April

title: Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly approves sub-classification of Scheduled Castes; we have kept our word, asserts Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: The sub-classification will be based on the 2011 Census, with Andhra Pradesh as a single unit for implementation, he says, adding that it will be applied at the district level from 2026

title: Middlemen looting paddy farmers in Nellore, alleges YSRCP leader
content: The MSP has been fixed at ₹19,800 per ‘putti’, but the farmers are selling it to middlemen for ₹15,000 per putti due to various reasons, says former Minister

title: Fogging request to be available at a click on My GHMC app
content: After fogging is completed, a photo of the operation will be uploaded along with the geo-coordinates, as a proof of the job attended

title: Is JuJu Watkins the best player in the women’s NCAA tournament? We rank the top 25
content: it's a time for stars to win the ultimate NCAA tournament . a chance to win their first national championship . the WNBA is a year for stars who don't win the NCAA title . it is the first time a player has won a national championship since march .

title: Men's NCAA tournament: Live updates, highlights, analysis from Day 1
content: the men's 2025 tournament takes place on march 1 . the tournament is the first in a row . it's the first time a team has won the tournament . if you're watching all 16 first-round games or refreshing score pages, consider this .

title: White Sox's 'Celebration Cake Shake' leads new MLB park confections
content: baseball teams are becoming more innovative and stepping up their food game in 2025 . the "Celebration Cake Shake" features birthday cake ice cream, confetti cake, a pinwheel cookie and a maraschino cherry . this follows the White Sox's "Campfire Milkshake" from last season .

title: ESPN to broadcast 26 WNBA games, 10 for Fever
content: ESPN/ABC will broadcast 26 WNBA games this season, including 10 for the Indiana Fever and nine for the defending champion New York Liberty . the regular season is expanded to 44 games . more than 175 games will be broadcast across multiple platforms .

title: Inside MLB's process of authenticating game-used items
content: pitcher Roki Sasaki wears an MLB debut patch on the left sleeve of his jersey . the patch will be embedded into his one-of-one numbered Topps Chrome Update Rookie Debut Patch Autograph Card . it's important for collectors to covet, chase and ultimately pull items that come off the field .

title: Predicting 10 women's early-round upsets
content: the 2023 women's NCAA tournament produced four upsets . there were five in 2022, the second round gave us one last year and two the year before that . a no. 10 over a No. 7 counts just like a . no. 6 beating a. 3 in the first round .

title: Way-Too-Early Top 25: Next season's breakout player for every team
content: the 2025 season is on the way and several budding players on our Way-Too-Early Top 25 teams are primed for breakout campaigns . incoming freshman running back Gideon Davidson could give Clemson's offense an immediate jolt .

title: Dickie V makes his March Madness picks for every game
content: the big dance is here, and I'm ready to break it down, Dickie V style! we've got PTPers (prime time performers), diaper dandies and championship-caliber coaching ready to take the court .

title: From Jackrabbits to 'King Triton': March Madness boasts unique mascots
content: the bulldog is one of the most iconic mascots in college sports . some of the world's most memorable ones have the honor of being inducted into the Mascot Hall of Fame . a few schools claim the breed as their mascotts, including Yale , Drake .

title: Let the fun begin: Make your picks for the women's tournament
content: Welcome back to the #1 Women's Bracket game! The tourney tips off Friday, 3/21 @ 11:30a ET - don't get locked out, create your brackets today! Be sure to create a group and invite your friends to share in the madness.

title: A new ‘China Shock’ is destroying jobs worldwide – with India in crosshairs
content: US President Trump is intensifying his trade war, imposing tariffs on India from April 2 for what he claims are unfair duties on US goods. While targeting China’s economic expansion, the resulting oversupply of cheap Chinese products is harming local industries globally. Countries like India are considering tariff reductions to avert a full-scale trade war.

title: 'Badar Luck': Indian scholar faces deportation over Hamas links
content: US immigration authorities have detained Indian researcher Badar Khan Suri from Georgetown University for alleged pro-Hamas activism, purportedly violating visa terms. Suri, with critical views on Israeli actions in Gaza, faces deportation. Georgetown University maintains Suri’s innocence and supports open inquiry. Suri’s lawyer decries the detention, emphasizing Suri's focus on peace-building.

title: 'Cried throughout, didn't eat food': How 'killer' Meerut wife spent 1st night in prison
content: Muskan Rastogi, along with her lover Sahil Shukla, has been accused of murdering and dismembering her husband, Saurabh Rajput, whose body was found encased in cement. Both accused are in judicial custody as investigations continue, revealing a premeditated crime stemming from their rekindled relationship.

title: Pak board hits jackpot with USD 10 million profit after Champions Trophy
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) is set to earn approximately USD 10 million from hosting the Champions Trophy, exceeding their initial target. The PCB's total revenue for the 2023-24 fiscal year reached Rs 10 billion, a 40% increase from the previous year, placing them among the top three richest cricket boards globally.

title: Amazon layoffs: When CEO Andy Jassy said he wants fewer managers because ...
content: Amazon is reportedly cutting 14,000 jobs, although the company has not officially confirmed this figure. CEO Andy Jassy is pushing for a flatter company structure by reducing middle management. Despite employee backlash, Amazon is also enforcing a strict five-day return-to-office policy to strengthen company culture.

title: Watch: Nitish 'talks' during national anthem, Tejashwi questions his health
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav criticized Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for disrespecting the national anthem and questioned his health. A video showed Kumar talking during the anthem. Yadav demanded his resignation, citing instability.

title: 'Denied him food, abused us,' says relative of man killed by wife, her lover
content: In Jaipur, a woman and her lover were arrested for allegedly murdering her husband, Dhannalal Saini, after he confronted them about their affair. The duo attempted to burn his body to destroy evidence. The incident mirrors a similar recent case in Meerut. The victim's family suspects more people might be involved.

title: Kirsty Coventry elected first female president of IOC
content: Kirsty Coventry has been elected as the first female president of the International Olympic Committee (IOC). IOC members voted on Thursday to appoint Coventry, a seven-time Olympic swimming medalist, for an eight-year term, which can be extended for an additional four years. She succeeds Thomas Bach, who steps down after 12 years, and emphasized her commitment to working alongside the six other high-profile candidates she defeated in the election.

title: Ben Stiller, Paul McCartney, 400-plus stars urge US to act against Google, OpenAI
content: Over 400 Hollywood celebrities, including Ben Stiller and Paul McCartney, oppose OpenAI and Google's attempts to relax copyright laws for AI training. They assert that such changes threaten the entertainment industry, which supports millions of jobs and significant wages annually, emphasizing the broader impact on America's cultural and knowledge sectors.

title: Samay Raina cancels India tour after third summon over Latent controversy
content: Stand-up comedian Samay Raina has shared an important update regarding his upcoming shows in India amid the ongoing controversy surrounding India’s Got Latent. Samay, who had initially scheduled performances across multiple cities, has now cancelled all his shows, despite tickets being sold out through advance bookings. On Thursday (March 20), Samay took to his Instagram story and announced the rescheduling of his India tour.

title: 'Not one who changes game': J&K CM dismisses speculation of 'moving close to BJP'
content: Jammu and Kashmir chief minister Omar Abdullah dismissed speculation about his closeness to BJP, affirming his commitment to his objectives. During his speech in the J&K Assembly, Abdullah emphasized adaptability and addressed accusations regarding Article 370 and other issues. He reiterated his readiness to face tough questions and challenged allegations against his party regarding Maharaja Hari Singh.

title: Three injured in road accident near Irumpanam in Kochi
content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

title: Impact Player Rule To Continue In IPL. Slow Over-Rate Conditions Tweaked
content: the board of control for cricket in India (BCCI) has made some significant changes in rules for IPL 2025 . the changes include the lifting of the saliva ban, the continuation of the Impact Player rule and slow over rate ban . captains will no longer face a ban for slow over rates .

title: Kirsty Coventry Elected First Woman President Of International Olympic Committee
content: Kirsty Coventry is the first woman and african woman to be elected president of the international Olympic Committee . the 41-year-old is also the youngest ever person to hold the most powerful position in sports governance . she is a close ally of the German Thomas Bach, who steps down as IOC supremo .

title: Heart health matters: Join TOI's Medithon for expert insights
content: Heart diseases are becoming more prevalent due to lifestyle choices and genetic factors. Prevention through healthy habits, regular check-ups, and awareness is crucial. The Times of India will host a medithon on March 21 with top cardiologists discussing heart disease risks and prevention. Sessions will cover managing heart diseases and specific impacts on youngsters and women.

title: Elon Musk’s go-to man at DOGE is SpaceX’s 22nd employee, Meet
content: Steve Davis, a longtime collaborator of Elon Musk, is appointed as the head of the Department of Government Efficiency to streamline US government operations. Known for his relentless cost-cutting at SpaceX and Twitter, Davis aims to eliminate waste and improve efficiency at the government level.

title: BJP & Uddhav Sena cross swords over Aaditya as Disha case resurfaces
content: Satish Salian has filed a fresh plea in the Bombay High Court, seeking action against Aaditya Thackeray and alleging a cover-up by Mumbai Police in his daughter Disha's death investigation. This has revived a political storm in Maharashtra, with BJP leaders demanding action while opposition figures question the timing and motive behind the petition.

title: Amaal Mallik deletes post about depression and distancing from family
content: Singer and composer Amaal Mallik has deleted his recent social media post in which he opened up about his battle with depression and his decision to distance himself from his family. The musician has now shared a statement clarifying his stance and requesting media platforms to be mindful while reporting on the matter.

title: IPL 2025: KKR vs LSG match shifted from Kolkata to Guwahati
content: Kolkata Knight Riders' home IPL match against Lucknow Super Giants on April 6 will be relocated to Guwahati due to security concerns linked to 'Ram Navami' celebrations in Kolkata. Cricket Association of Bengal president Snehasish Ganguly has confirmed the rescheduling after BJP announced extensive processions in the city. The highly anticipated clash between KKR and LSG, owned by RPSG Group chairman Sanjiv Goenka, was expected to attract a packed stadium, with both teams enjoying strong local support.

title: Elon Musk's X sues Centre for using IT Act to 'block' content
content: Elon Musk's X filed a lawsuit against the Indian government for allegedly misusing the IT Act to block content on the platform. The case challenges the interpretation of Section 79(3)(b), claiming it leads to arbitrary censorship and violates Supreme Court rulings. X seeks clearer guidelines and a proper judicial process for content blocking.

title: IPL 2025 rules: What has changed and what has remained the same
content: IPL 2025 will see the reintroduction of saliva on the ball and a new 'Second Ball' rule to mitigate dew effects. The Impact Player rule remains, and DRS will now cover height-based no-balls and off-side wides. BCCI’s updates aim to enhance match excitement and maintain fairness in gameplay. TimesofIndia.com takes a look at the key updates.

title: 'Babasaheb's dream remains unfulfilled': Rahul's on caste census
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and professor Sukhadeo Thorat discuss the need for a caste census in India and highlight BR Ambedkar's movement against caste discrimination. Gandhi emphasizes that the caste census is essential to highlight inequality. He also expresses commitment to continuing Ambedkar's fight for the access of Dalits to governance, education, bureaucracy, and resources.

title: 'Forced conversions': Minorities facing persecution in Pak, says govt
content: The Union government told Parliament there have been reports of violence and discrimination against minority communities, including Hindus, in Pakistan. Many Hindus are reportedly migrating from Sindh province due to intimidation, abduction, forced conversions and forced marriages. Hindu migrants in India can apply for Long Term Visas and seek permanent settlement and Indian citizenship.

title: Who was Eddie Jordan? Everything you need to know about former F1 team owner
content: Eddie Jordan, a visionary and entrepreneur, significantly impacted motorsports through his racing team, Jordan Grand Prix, and by discovering future stars like Michael Schumacher. Eddie, who later became a popular broadcaster, passed away at 76 after battling cancer, leaving a lasting legacy in Formula 1.

title: Why dark energy is losing its force
content: Recently, two major research groups—the Dark Energy Spectroscopic Instrument (DESI) and the Dark Energy Survey (DES)—have collected massive amounts of data by observing millions of galaxies. Their findings suggest that dark energy is not constant; instead, it appears to be losing strength over time.

title: Facing dragon’s fire, Manila turns to Delhi: Philippines wants India to join ‘squad’
content: The Philippines is urging India to join the US, Australia, and Japan in the 'Squad' alliance to counter China's territorial expansion in the South China Sea. Amid concerns over China's coercive tactics, military officials discussed bolstering maritime security in the Indo-Pacific during the Raisina Dialogue.

title: Woman kills husband with lover in Rajasthan, sets body on fire
content: A 42-year-old woman and her 30-year-old lover have been arrested for allegedly murdering her husband and setting his body on fire in Jaipur. The perpetrators conspired to kill the victim, a vegetable vendor, and burned his body in a forest area, attempting to cover their tracks.

title: Kolkata techie jumps to death from office building
content: A senior manager at an Indo-American IT company, Dwaipayan Bhattacharjee, died by suicide after jumping from the 6th-floor refuge area of his Kolkata office. Police investigations revealed he was battling depression and under medication. CCTV footage and his gadgets are being reviewed to understand the circumstances.

title: When Shoaib Malik's sister didn't attend his second wedding with Sana Javed
content: Shoaib Malik's sisters reveal his family didn’t attend his nikah, hinting at the reasons behind his divorce from Sania Mirza. Sania's family confirms the separation, addressing concerns related to Shoaib's alleged extramarital affairs. Shoaib's nikah with Sana Javed is confirmed through his Instagram post.

title: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney to call snap election on April 28: Reports
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is expected to call a snap election with voting likely on April 28. The campaign will focus on escalating trade tensions with the U.S. and President Trump's rhetoric. Carney aims to protect Canadian workers and strengthen global alliances.

title: What is Indian-origin Badar Khan Suri's alleged connection to Hamas?
content: Badar Khan Suri's petition said he had no criminal record and had not been charged with a crime. His wife Mapheze Saleh was the reason Suri was targeted, the petition said adding that Saleh allegedly had ties with Hamas and once worked for Al Jazeera. Saleh's father Ahmed Yousef was reportedly a senior political adviser to the Hamas leadership. A Wikipedia page on Ahmed Yousef described him as the disciple of the founder of Hamas, Sheikh Ahmed Yasin. It describes Yousef as Hamas' gate to the West because of his years of living in the US.

title: Meerut murder: Lawyers beat up Muskan, her lover
content: A woman and her lover were remanded to judicial custody after being accused of murdering her Merchant Navy officer husband, dismembering his body, and concealing it in cement. The couple confessed and were assaulted by lawyers during a court hearing in Meerut.

title: J&K BJP leader and ex-MLA shoots himself dead
content: BJP leader and former independent MLA Faqir Mohammad Khan from Jammu and Kashmir's Gurez died by suicide on Thursday. He was found dead inside the Tulsibagh government quarters in Srinagar. Chief Minister Omar Abdullah and other officials expressed condolences. Khan, who joined the BJP in 2020, contested unsuccessfully in last year's assembly elections.

title: How Eddie Jordan, Michael Schumacher’s first boss was banned from visiting him
content: Eddie Jordan, who passed away at 76, was instrumental in Michael Schumacher's legendary Formula One career. In 1991, he gave Schumacher his debut at the Belgian Grand Prix. Despite losing Schumacher to Benetton, their friendship endured. Jordan respected the Schumacher family's privacy after Michael's 2013 accident, acknowledging the immense strain on his wife, Corinna.

title: Ozempic-like weight loss drug Mounjaro launched in India - Details
content: Eli Lilly has launched Mounjaro in India, a new once-weekly injectable drug for type 2 diabetes and weight management. Approved by CDSCO, it targets GIP and GLP-1 receptors, aiming to improve blood sugar control and aid in weight loss. Clinical trials showed significant results, underlining its potential in treating diabetes and obesity.

title: Ex-NHL coach blasts New York Rangers’ playoff chances, calls out team for horrific performance
content: The New York Rangers struggled in their 2-1 loss to the Calgary Flames, generating only 13 shots and showing low urgency. Coach Peter Laviolette acknowledged the lack of effort, while former NHL figures criticized the team's trades and performance. With their playoff spot at risk, the Rangers must quickly improve their competitiveness.

title: Why Trump cannot make Americans happy
content: A loneliness epidemic is gripping the country, particularly among young adults, with one in five reporting they have no close friends. More Americans are dining alone, living alone, and spending less time engaging in meaningful social interactions. Political polarisation is at an all-time high, creating two completely separate realities, where people see opposing views as existential threats. Perhaps most alarming, deaths of despair—suicides, drug overdoses, and alcohol-related deaths—are still rising in the US, even as they decline in other countries. The most disillusioned group isn’t Trump or Biden supporters but abstainers—those who don’t vote at all—who report the lowest levels of happiness and the highest levels of alienation. Simply put, America is becoming wealthier but lonelier, more divided, and more distrustful—a toxic combination that keeps dragging national happiness down.

title: Daggubati, Devarakonda, other actors booked for promoting betting apps
content: Prominent Tollywood actors, including Rana Daggubati and Prakash Raj, among others, face charges for promoting online betting apps, as per a complaint from a local resident. The police have intensified efforts to curb this issue, launching an online awareness campaign #SayNoToBettingApps to educate the public about the dangers of online betting.

title: 'Yuzvendra Chahal, Dhanashree are no longer husband and wife'
content: Yuzvendra Chahal's divorce from Dhanashree Verma has been finalised, with the court accepting their joint petition. The couple, who married in December 2020, had been living separately for over two years. The Bombay High Court expedited the process considering Chahal's IPL commitments. Dhanashree is notable for her dance performances. Dhanashree and Chahal got engaged in 2020 and tied the knot in December of the same year in a private ceremony in Gurugram.

title: What is the 'Second Ball' rule in IPL 2025? All you need to know
content: The IPL 2025 introduces the 'Second Ball' rule to counter the impact of dew in night matches, ensuring fair play for bowlers. Additionally, the BCCI lifts the saliva ban, making the IPL the first major cricket tournament to reintroduce saliva use after the COVID-19 pandemic. Under this rule, on-field umpires will assess the condition of the ball after the 11th over of the second innings. If excessive dew is detected, the bowling team will be permitted to use a new ball.

title: Oops, he does it again! Nitish loses cool, this time over mobile phones
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar demanded a ban on mobile phones in the assembly, criticizing their use by legislators during sessions. This led to a heated exchange with opposition leaders, who accused him of being anti-technology and outdated. Kumar's criticisms also extended to the previous governments led by Rabri Devi and her husband, Lalu Yadav.

title: Meerut: How wife lured lover to murder ex-merchant navy officer
content: Saurabh Rajput was murdered by his wife Muskan and her accomplice Sahil after returning from London to celebrate her birthday in Meerut. Muskan had manipulated Sahil by exploiting his grief and orchestrating the murder for months. Her parents have demanded the death penalty for her.

title: Top reasons stock markets rallied today
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Thursday. While BSE Sensex rose around 1,000 points intraday, Nifty50 crossed the 23,200 mark.

title: New Zealand PM Christopher Luxon plays cricket at Mumbai’s Wankhede Stadium
content: New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon visited Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium, engaging with Kiwi cricketers Ajaz Patel, Ross Taylor, and Trent Boult. Luxon celebrated India-New Zealand cricketing ties and Patel's historic ten-wicket feat at the stadium. During his official visit, Luxon played cricket with children in Delhi, strengthening the bond between the two nations.

title: Former CSK star brutally mocks RCB - WATCH
content: The 18th edition of the Indian Premier League (IPL) starts on March 22, 2025, with defending champions Kolkata Knight Riders facing Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Former CSK player Subramaniam Badrinath recently mocked RCB on Instagram. AB de Villiers highlighted the tough challenges of winning the IPL and expressed hope that RCB, led by Virat Kohli, will claim the trophy this season.

title: Air India may place order for 30-40 new wide-body jets from Airbus, Boeing: Report
content: Air India is in discussions to order 30 to 40 wide-body aircraft, including Airbus A350 and Boeing 777X models, potentially exceeding 50. The move is part of their transformation under Tata Group ownership.
